column4: does anyone have an idea of what program to use to payback m4a files
mplayer will do it, as will realplayer10
get the installer, not the RPM
it says that the file cannot be displayed
what do you do before it says that
you click on the file in nautilus (file manager)?
ok, cool (you can think of the desktop as being a window of nautilus without borders)
have you got a terminal open?
then chmod +x (whatever your realplayer download was called)
